result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark J Perry was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark J Perry

defendant.name: Perry, Mark J
defendant.address: 203 W Sunny Lane Rd, Janesville, WI 53546

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Mark J Perry
Current: 203 W Sunny Lane Rd, Janesville, WI 53546 United States  (Effective: 10-20-2016)
Prior: 1009 W Main St, Princeton, WI 54968
Petition and Stipulation to Waive Appearance and Order Extending Probation for Unpaid Court Obligations - 1 year, New Discharge Date November 24, 2017

1:07 p.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Agent Kris Smoody present in court.  Court goes over monies due.  Statement by defendant, has been in treatment and was released to come to court today.  Agent Smoody confirms the defendant has been in treatment.  Statement by defendant - has a job and was to start today.  Agent Smoody requests to extend probation.  Court finds the defendant has not made a good faith effort and extends probation for one year.  Court informs defendant that if not paid off in the year, court will fashion conditions to include jail time.  Court goes over right to counsel.

Court adjourned at 1:11 p.m.
Probation review hearing on October 17, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
10:23 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by defendant - will plea GUILTY.  DA recites offer - upon plea to the charges, will recommend probation.  Defendant concurs.  Court goes over right to counsel.  Defendant waives right to counsel.  Court accepts waiver.

Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty and as domestic.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on both counts 1 & 2 as charged.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by DA.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:  (EACH COUNT) SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 1 year concurrent to each other.

CONDITIONS (EACH COUNT:

-Court costs.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.
-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court adjourned at 10:30 a.m.
Defendant in custody and present in court via video from the Green Lake County Jail and without counsel.
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  No Violent contact with Bonnie W.
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  No Violent contact with Bonnie W.

1:11 P.M.  Defendant in custody and present in court via video from the Green Lake County Jail and without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs the defendant of his right to an attorney.  Defendant stands mute.  Court enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond and conditions of:  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  No Violent contact with Bonnie W.  Court will set for Status Hearing on November 24, 2015 at 10:00 A.M.

Court adjourned at 1:14 p.m.
